description: Minimalist CodePen-like application with code editor on left and real-time data structure visualization on right. 100% client-side rendered.

tasks.title: Fix skeleton template loading error for all data structures
tasks.description: When selecting linkedList or other non-array data structures, the app shows black screen with error: 'Uncaught Error: No skeleton template found for linkedList (easy)'. All data structures must have skeleton templates for easy/medium/hard difficulties in src/templates/[dataStructure]/ directories.
acceptance_criteria: No console errors when switching between data structures
All data structures (array, linkedList, stack, queue, tree, graph, hashMap) load successfully
Each data structure has easy.ts, medium.ts, and hard.ts skeleton templates
Skeleton templates follow format: '// Example usage:' comment at top, one empty line, then function with TODOs
tasks.notes: CRITICAL BUG - blocks all non-array data structure usage. Must fix before UI improvements.

tasks.title: Remove 'Your code here' comments from all skeleton templates
tasks.description: All skeleton code templates currently contain 'Your code here' placeholder comments. Per PRD section 'Skeleton Code Format', skeleton templates should only have 'Example usage' comment at top, one empty line, then function with TODO comments and implementation hints. No 'Your code here' comments.
acceptance_criteria: Search codebase finds zero instances of 'Your code here' in src/templates/**/*.ts files
All skeleton templates start with '// Example usage:' comment
One empty line between 'Example usage' comment and function
Only TODO comments with specific hints inside function bodies
tasks.notes: Can only verify after skeleton templates exist for all data structures.

tasks.title: Remove emoji before Examples button
tasks.description: The Examples button in EditorPanel currently has an emoji prefix. Per minimalist design principles, remove the emoji. Button should show 'Examples' text only, optionally with Tabler icon.
acceptance_criteria: Examples button contains no emoji characters
Button shows 'Examples' text clearly
Optionally: uses appropriate Tabler icon (IconBooks, IconCode, etc.) positioned before text
tasks.notes: Simple UI cleanup following minimalist design principles.

tasks.title: Convert hints section to icon button with modal
tasks.description: Currently hints are displayed inline in EditorPanel. Convert to: (1) Single icon button positioned absolute top-right of editor using Tabler IconBulb or IconLightbulb, (2) Button opens modal dialog showing progressive hint reveal, (3) Modal follows HintModal component spec from PRD with clear close button and 'Reveal Hint N' buttons.
acceptance_criteria: Hints section removed from inline display
Icon button (IconBulb/IconLightbulb) positioned absolute top-right of editor
Clicking icon opens modal dialog
Modal shows 'Hints (revealed/total)' header
Modal has close button with IconX
Unrevealed hints show 'Reveal Hint N' buttons
Revealed hints show full hint text
Modal dismissible with ESC key or click outside
tasks.notes: Saves significant real estate while maintaining hint accessibility.

tasks.title: Remove speed controls from visualization panel
tasks.description: Per PRD 'Immediate Feedback' principles, speed controls are unnecessary. Visualization should auto-play all steps immediately at optimized speed with no user speed adjustment. Remove any speed control UI elements (sliders, dropdowns, speed buttons).
acceptance_criteria: No speed control UI elements visible in VisualizationPanel
Animations play at consistent, optimized speed
Auto-play executes immediately after code execution
Replay button still available to restart animation
Step back/forward controls still functional
tasks.notes: Simplifies UI by removing non-essential controls.

tasks.title: Show all 3 test cases simultaneously without difficulty filter
tasks.description: TestPanel currently may have difficulty filter buttons (Easy/Medium/Hard). Remove any filtering - display all 3 test cases for selected data structure simultaneously. User should see pass/fail status for all difficulties at once.
acceptance_criteria: No difficulty filter buttons or dropdown in TestPanel
All 3 test cases (Easy, Medium, Hard) visible simultaneously
Each test case shows: name, description, pass/fail status
Failed tests show error message and expected vs actual diff
Test results update after running code
tasks.notes: Eliminates unnecessary filtering, provides immediate feedback on all difficulty levels.

tasks.title: Add play button above editor for running all tests
tasks.description: Currently 'Run all tests' button may be embedded in layout. Move/create prominent play button positioned directly above CodeMirror editor. Use Tabler IconPlayerPlay. Button should trigger test execution for all 3 test cases of current data structure.
acceptance_criteria: Play button positioned above CodeMirror editor
Uses IconPlayerPlay from Tabler
Clear label like 'Run Tests' or 'Run All Tests'
Clicking runs all 3 test cases for current data structure
Button disabled during test execution
Visual feedback during execution (loading state)
tasks.notes: Makes test execution more prominent and discoverable.

tasks.title: Implement auto-play visualization on code execution
tasks.description: After user clicks play and tests execute successfully, visualization should immediately auto-play through all captured steps without user interaction. No need to click 'play' on visualization - it should start automatically. Animation plays once through all steps, then controls become available.
acceptance_criteria: Visualization starts playing immediately after successful test execution
Plays through all captured steps automatically
Plays at consistent, optimized speed (no speed control)
After completion, replay button and step controls become available
If test fails, visualization shows error state instead of auto-play
tasks.notes: Provides immediate visual feedback as per UX principles.

tasks.title: Add replay button for visualization
tasks.description: After visualization completes auto-play, add floating replay button over visualization area. Use IconReload or IconPlayerPlay from Tabler. Button should restart animation from beginning. Position consistent with other floating controls.
acceptance_criteria: Replay button appears after animation completes
Uses IconReload or IconPlayerPlay from Tabler
Positioned as floating action button over visualization
Clicking restarts animation from step 0
Button has appropriate aria-label for accessibility
tasks.notes: Enables users to re-watch animation without re-running code.

tasks.title: Add floating step back/forward controls
tasks.description: Add floating action buttons for manual step navigation. Two buttons: Step Back (IconArrowLeft/IconChevronLeft) and Step Forward (IconArrowRight/IconChevronRight). Position consistently over visualization area. Buttons should be disabled at boundaries (back at step 0, forward at last step).
acceptance_criteria: Two floating buttons visible over visualization
Step Back button uses IconArrowLeft or IconChevronLeft
Step Forward button uses IconArrowRight or IconChevronRight
Buttons positioned consistently (e.g., bottom-left and bottom-right)
Step Back disabled at step 0
Step Forward disabled at last step
Clicking updates visualization to previous/next step
Works independently of auto-play

tasks.title: Add horizontal slider for step navigation
tasks.description: Add horizontal slider positioned below visualization area for precise step navigation. Slider thumb position indicates current step. Shows total steps. Dragging slider jumps to specific step. Inspired by video player timeline controls (SyncSketch pattern).
acceptance_criteria: Horizontal slider positioned below visualization area
Slider range matches total steps (0 to steps.length - 1)
Thumb position indicates current step number
Dragging slider updates visualization in real-time
Display shows 'Step X / Y' or similar
Large enough thumb for easy interaction (accessibility)
Works independently of auto-play and floating controls
tasks.notes: Provides precise navigation like video player timeline.

tasks.title: Add strategic Tabler icons throughout UI
tasks.description: Following best practices for icon usage (icons with labels for important actions, standalone only for universal icons), add appropriate Tabler icons to UI controls. Examples: Examples button (IconBooks), Hints button (IconBulb), Settings if any (IconSettings). Don't overuse - strategic placement only.
acceptance_criteria: Examples button has appropriate icon (IconBooks, IconCode, etc.)
Hints icon button uses IconBulb or IconLightbulb
Play button uses IconPlayerPlay
Floating controls use appropriate arrow/replay icons
All icon buttons have descriptive aria-labels
Icons don't clutter interface - used strategically
Icon size consistent across UI
tasks.notes: Low priority - enhances visual appeal but not critical functionality.

tasks.title: Fix Examples dialog UI/UX
tasks.description: The PresetSelector modal (Examples dialog) needs UX improvements. Ensure: clear modal structure, category filtering works correctly, complexity badges visible, code preview if applicable, obvious close button, responsive layout.
acceptance_criteria: Modal opens/closes smoothly
Category filters work correctly
Each example shows: name, description, complexity badge
Clicking example loads code into editor and closes modal
Close button clearly visible (IconX)
Modal dismissible with ESC key
Responsive layout on different screen sizes
No layout issues or overlapping elements
tasks.notes: Polish task - improves UX but not blocking other features.

tasks.title: Remove share functionality
tasks.description: If any share functionality exists (share buttons, share links, export features for sharing), remove it entirely. This is a local-only educational tool - sharing features add unnecessary complexity.
acceptance_criteria: No share buttons or links in UI
No share-related code in components
No export-for-sharing functionality
Local storage persistence still works (different from sharing)
tasks.notes: Simplifies codebase by removing non-core feature. Only remove if exists.

validation_criteria.tests_pass: npm run test:run exits with code 0
validation_criteria.types_valid: npm run typecheck exits with code 0
validation_criteria.linting_passes: npm run lint exits with code 0
validation_criteria.formatting_correct: npm run format:check exits with code 0

exit_conditions: App loads successfully with no console errors

notes.iteration_strategy: Prioritize bug-001 first (critical blocker). Then tackle other high-priority items. Save polish tasks (low priority) for final iterations.
notes.testing_approach: Run npm run validate after each task completion to ensure no regressions.
notes.reference_documentation: See PRD.md for comprehensive technical specifications, architecture details, and UI/UX best practices.
